content.description: An easy up or down climb.  Great for warmup or if you’re scrambling the hill to Spearhead.  Left hand reaches up to any ledge.  Right hand on the 3” crystal hold below eye-level.  Feet are whatever you want.  High-step up with right foot onto the 3” crystal.  Work up above the crack, then another move or two to send.
content.location: Stacked boulders immediately right of Blood Tax.  There’s a circled “1” painted on the lower face.

content.description: Short but very stout. Start with hands on the bottom of the steeply slanting rail in the middle of the boulder and feet deep underneath on a good edge. Do a lot of twisting and turning and squeezing to follow the steep rail to the top. Good holds, but harder than it looks.
content.location: Middle of the black widow boulder.

content.description: Start with your left foot in the obvious cutout (bottom center of photo).  Right foot can match, smear, or rest on any feature.  Hands on face or in a crack.  High-step right foot up to a shallow ledge.  Balance, step up, and insert left foot into the large crack.  Match feet.  Work up the face using cracks and dishes.  The arete on the left of the upper face is off.
content.location: Stacked boulders around the corner from Warm Me Up (to the far right of Blood Tax).

content.description: Featured face with overhung no feet bottom. Block underneath has the faded words black windows spray painted on it.
